No, it is not a regression issue ### Issue description **Current Behavior:** The display of buttons and scrollbar controls in the HC theme is not consistent with the normal theme. HC Aquatic theme: HC Desert theme: HC Dusk theme: HC Night Sky theme: **Expected Behavior:** The display of buttons and scrollbar controls in the HC theme is consistent with the normal theme. Normal theme: ### Steps to reproduce 1. Turn on High Contrast theme in Windows settings 2. Create a WinForms .NET core project 3. Add abutton, VScrollBar and HScrollBar control 4. Ctrl+Shift+A add a Application Manifest File and uncomment windows 10 5. Build and run **More Info:** 1. This issue is repro on all HC themes. 2. This issue is repro on framework project.

Issues.Title: [HDPI] The Icon of checkbox in DateTimePicker control is burry
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

NET 8.0.100-alpha.1.22451.15

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

Yes

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

No, this is not a regression issue.

### Issue description

The Icon of checkbox in DateTimePicker control is burry in high DPI.

Win11 OS:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/62929087/188042110-c7db6b06-145f-4024-b1b9-8c22e4f6a9eb.png)

Win10 OS:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/62929087/188042266-8804d04e-cced-4d0e-9254-45d94cba4213.png)


### Steps to reproduce

[TestApp.zip](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/files/9474349/TestApp.zip)

1. Create a WinForms .NET core project.
2. Drag and drop a DateTimePicker to the form designer, set the "ShowCheckBox" as True.
3. Add an App.manifest to this project and uncomment:
```
<!-- Windows 10 -->
<supportedOS Id="{8e0f7a12-bfb3-4fe8-b9a5-48fd50a15a9a}" />
```
4. Set Windows DPI as 200%.
5. Build and run this project.

### More info:
1. This is a high DPI issue, and it doesn't repro on 100% DPI.
2. Individual Checkbox control cannot repro this issue.
3. Win10 and Win11 OS all can repro this issue.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[HDPI] The Icon of checkbox in DateTimePicker control is burry " (#7718)

Issues.Title: Got an exception when a TextBlock got focus: `System.Globalization.CultureNotFoundException:“Argument_CultureNotSupportedInInvariantMode Arg_ParamName_Name, culture Argument_CultureInvalidIdentifier, 2052 (0x0804)”`
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

 Version:   6.0.303
 Commit:    7494fee64a

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

No

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

I don't know how to switch a wpf project target SDK.

### Issue description

My code works well when I build it for debug, but not working in release mode.

There are two textblock in this window, and the exception will be throwed when I click any textblock. But  the exception will NOT be throwed in debug build mode.

```log
System.Globalization.CultureNotFoundException:“Argument_CultureNotSupportedInInvariantMode Arg_ParamName_Name, culture Argument_CultureInvalidIdentifier, 2052 (0x0804)”
```
```xml
<Window x:Class="Logistical.QueueManagementClient.Forms.LoginWindow"
        xmlns="http://schemas.microsoft.com/winfx/2006/xaml/presentation"
        xmlns:x="http://schemas.microsoft.com/winfx/2006/xaml"
        xmlns:d="http://schemas.microsoft.com/expression/blend/2008"
        xmlns:mc="http://schemas.openxmlformats.org/markup-compatibility/2006"
        xmlns:local="clr-namespace:Logistical.QueueManagementClient"
        mc:Ignorable="d"
        Closing="Window_Closing"
        Title="登录" Height="573" Width="978">
    <Window.Resources>
        <!--依赖属性 本页面用的样式-->
        <Style TargetType="Button">
            <Setter Property="Background" Value="Gold"></Setter>
            <Setter Property="Foreground" Value="Black"></Setter>
            <Setter Property="FontSize" Value="20"></Setter>
        </Style>
    </Window.Resources>
    <Grid >
        <!--定义行 2行 比例59:361-->
        <Grid.RowDefinitions>
            <RowDefinition Height="2*"/>
            <RowDefinition Height="3*"/>
            <RowDefinition Height="1*"/>
        </Grid.RowDefinitions>
        <!--定义列 2列 比例51:208-->
        <Grid.ColumnDefinitions>
            <ColumnDefinition Width="20*"/>
            <ColumnDefinition Width="55*"/>
            <ColumnDefinition Width="20*"/>
        </Grid.ColumnDefinitions>
        <!--在第一行，第二列写入一个按钮 
        Grid.Row="0" Grid.Column="1" 是索引 
        Grid.Row="0"表示第一行
        Grid.Column="1"  表示第二列-->
        <StackPanel  Grid.Row="1" Grid.Column="1" HorizontalAlignment="Center">
            <StackPanel Orientation="Horizontal" Height="30">
                <Label  Content="用户名" Width="60"/>
                <TextBox x:Name="user"  Text="admin" Width="200"/>
            </StackPanel>
            <StackPanel  Orientation="Horizontal" Height="30">
                <Label  Content="密    码" Width="60"/>
                <PasswordBox  x:Name="password" Width="200" />
            </StackPanel>
            <Button x:Name="loginBtn" Margin="22" Height="30" Background="{x:Null}" Content="登录" Click="LoginBtn_ClickAsync"/>
        </StackPanel>
    </Grid>
</Window>
```

### Steps to reproduce

```xml
<Project Sdk="Microsoft.NET.Sdk">

	<PropertyGroup>
		<RuntimeIdentifier>win-x64</RuntimeIdentifier>
		<OutputType>WinExe</OutputType>
		<TargetFramework>net6.0-windows</TargetFramework>
		<Nullable>enable</Nullable>
		<UseWPF>true</UseWPF>
		<SelfContained>true</SelfContained>
		<PublishSingleFile>false</PublishSingleFile>
	</PropertyGroup>

	<ItemGroup>
		<PackageReference Include="System.Text.Json" Version="6.0.2" />
		<PackageReference Include="System.Text.Encoding.CodePages" Version="6.0.0" />
	</ItemGroup>
	
</Project>
```
```xml
<Window x:Class="Logistical.QueueManagementClient.Forms.LoginWindow"
        xmlns="http://schemas.microsoft.com/winfx/2006/xaml/presentation"
        xmlns:x="http://schemas.microsoft.com/winfx/2006/xaml"
        xmlns:d="http://schemas.microsoft.com/expression/blend/2008"
        xmlns:mc="http://schemas.openxmlformats.org/markup-compatibility/2006"
        xmlns:local="clr-namespace:Logistical.QueueManagementClient"
        mc:Ignorable="d"
        Closing="Window_Closing"
        Title="登录" Height="573" Width="978">
    <Window.Resources>
        <!--依赖属性 本页面用的样式-->
        <Style TargetType="Button">
            <Setter Property="Background" Value="Gold"></Setter>
            <Setter Property="Foreground" Value="Black"></Setter>
            <Setter Property="FontSize" Value="20"></Setter>
        </Style>
    </Window.Resources>
    <Grid >
        <!--定义行 2行 比例59:361-->
        <Grid.RowDefinitions>
            <RowDefinition Height="2*"/>
            <RowDefinition Height="3*"/>
            <RowDefinition Height="1*"/>
        </Grid.RowDefinitions>
        <!--定义列 2列 比例51:208-->
        <Grid.ColumnDefinitions>
            <ColumnDefinition Width="20*"/>
            <ColumnDefinition Width="55*"/>
            <ColumnDefinition Width="20*"/>
        </Grid.ColumnDefinitions>
        <!--在第一行，第二列写入一个按钮 
        Grid.Row="0" Grid.Column="1" 是索引 
        Grid.Row="0"表示第一行
        Grid.Column="1"  表示第二列-->
        <StackPanel  Grid.Row="1" Grid.Column="1" HorizontalAlignment="Center">
            <StackPanel Orientation="Horizontal" Height="30">
                <Label  Content="用户名" Width="60"/>
                <TextBox x:Name="user"  Text="admin" Width="200"/>
            </StackPanel>
            <StackPanel  Orientation="Horizontal" Height="30">
                <Label  Content="密    码" Width="60"/>
                <PasswordBox  x:Name="password" Width="200" />
            </StackPanel>
            <Button x:Name="loginBtn" Margin="22" Height="30" Background="{x:Null}" Content="登录" Click="LoginBtn_ClickAsync"/>
        </StackPanel>
    </Grid>
</Window>
```

build it in release mode and click a textInput area, and it will crash.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Got an exception when a TextBlock got focus: `System.Globalization.CultureNotFoundException:“Argument_CultureNotSupportedInInvariantMode Arg_ParamName_Name, culture Argument_CultureInvalidIdentifier, 2052 (0x0804)”`" (#7742)

Issues.Title: [HC] Menustrips' child control textbox borders are not visible
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

8.0.100-alpha.1.22451.15

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

No

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

No, it is not a regression issue

### Issue description

Cu**rrent Behavior:**
Menustrips' child control textbox borders are not visible
HC Aquatic theme:
![A6](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/104609169/188589900-c1403e7c-40a4-4861-9c24-2d72744781f0.png)


HC Desert theme:
![A2](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/104609169/188589977-85983551-4492-4968-a120-1f9d6d4e2892.png)


HC Dusk theme:
![A3](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/104609169/188590019-bd145af5-e015-4a5f-8587-32e6e74b4dc7.png)


HC Night Sky theme:
![A4](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/104609169/188590061-826f1679-9a22-4701-838c-6dd7328102f6.png)


E**xpected Behavior:**
Menustrips' child control textbox borders can be seen
![1](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/104609169/188532860-eb07a017-890c-4009-9156-97b772ca7875.png)





### Steps to reproduce

1. Turn on High Contrast theme in Windows settings
2. Create a WinForms .NET core project
3. Add MenuStrip control
4. Add child controls MenuItem, TextBox, ComboBox respectively
5. Ctrl+Shift+A add a Application Manifest File and uncomment windows 10
6. Build and run

**More Info:**

1. This issue is repro on all HC themes.
2. This issue is repro on framework project.

Issues.Title: [Servicing] Fixing "Collection was modified ..." exception while MonthCalendar AO tree rebuilding
Issues.Body:
Fixes https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/issues/7714
.NET 8.0 PR #7738

The reason of the bug was calling RebuildAccessibilityTree 2 times at the same time via CalendarViewChanged and DisplayRangeChanged events.
Removed CalendarViewChanged event using because it duplicates the work of DisplayRangeChanged and leads to the exception. We release elements the first rebuilding time and catch the exception while the second call.

## Servicing reasons

- The regression breaks accessibility work of `MonthCalendar` in .NET 7.0 only after [#7362](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/7362) and [#7569](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/7569)

## Proposed changes

- Remove extra `CalendarViewChanged` usage
- Remove extra cleaning methods that duplicate disconnection methods work

<!-- We are in TELL-MODE the following section must be completed -->

## Customer Impact

- There is no the exception while using Narrator with MonthCalendar


## Regression? 

- Yes ([#7362](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/7362) and [#7569](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/7569) exposed the problem in [#4758](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/4758))

## Risk

- Minimal

## Test methodology <!-- How did you ensure quality? -->

- CTI
- Manual testing

## Accessibility testing  <!-- Remove this section if PR does not change UI -->

- Using Narrator and AI


## Test environment(s) <!-- Remove any that don't apply -->

- .NET 7.0
- Windows 11

Issues.Title: [Accessibility] [HC] ComboBox control's FlatStyle is not displayed correctly in design and runtime when set FlatStyle property to Flat or Popup
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

8.0.100-alpha.1.22430.2

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

Yes

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

Yes, it works in .NET 6.0.
![6 0-Aquatic](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/45864985/188091624-debb1e8b-60fe-4f12-bba5-0f2a4226e35e.png)


### Issue description

On Windows 11 and Windows 10 all high contrast themes, the ComboBox control's FlatStyle is not displayed correctly in design and runtime when set FlatStyle property to Flat or Popup.

Windows 11 HC Aquatic/Desert/Dusk/Night Sky testing results:
![Win11-1](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/45864985/188093170-8303c05b-23d3-4d8e-b76f-8310914844b2.png)
![Win11-2](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/45864985/188093213-746dfdff-87fd-4d7a-83ff-a7e48ec1fcea.png)

2. Open the [TestApp.zip](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/files/9475963/TestApp.zip) project.

4. Run the project, and observe the ComboBox controls in **Flat** and **Popup** columns too.

Issues.Title: [Accessibility] Narrator focuses on the Column Headers instead of the first cell when enter DataGridView by switching Form
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

8.0.100-alpha.1.22430.2

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

Yes

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

Yes, it is a regression issue, cannot repro .Net 6.0, for 7.0 version, 

### Issue description

Narrator focuses on the Column Headers instead of the first cell when enter DataGridView by switching Form. If application has one Form with DataGridView, Narrator focuses on the entire DataGridView instead of first cell

Actual Gif:
**2 Forms:**
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/26474449/188046094-edb8ee01-684d-4af8-b8cc-a8de1804fb6b.png)
![DataGridView_NarratorFocus](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/26474449/188046113-107a653d-41eb-4aac-aba5-37ce9970c83b.gif)
**1 Form:**
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/26474449/188048464-23521d3d-a03a-4ead-bb77-8efa80f06cfa.png)

Expected Gif from .Net 6.0:
**2 Forms:**
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/26474449/188046138-c84b46df-84ba-4d8e-b9cb-1f29019106dc.png)
![DataGridView_NarratorFocus_6 0 gif](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/26474449/188050894-5d5b2eb1-ed6c-41d4-beba-14c5902dac99.gif)

**1 Form:**
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/26474449/188048670-2a1c6527-3375-4996-8ff6-1be69892b5ed.png)


### Steps to reproduce

1. Create a Winforms .Net Core application, Form1 with DataGridView added
2. Add several columns in DataGridView
3. Add a Form2 to this project, and add a button to Form2
4. Double click button to generate event with following code
            
```
            Form1 form1 = new Form1();
            form1.ShowDialog();
```
5. Set Form2 as start form, build and run application

or use attached sample application for testing
[DataGridViewSample.zip](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/files/9474550/DataGridViewSample.zip)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "[Accessibility] Narrator focuses on the Column Headers instead of the first cell when enter DataGridView by switching Form" (#7723)

Issues.Body: ### .NET version .NET 8.0.100-alpha.1.22451.15 ### Did it work in .NET Framework? No ### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+? No, it is not a regression issue ### Issue description **Current Behavior:** The icon of "AddNew" in DataGridView control is unclear. HC Aquatic theme: HC Dusk theme: HC Night Sky theme: **Expected Behavior:** The icon of "AddNew" in DataGridView control should be clear. win11 HC Desert theme: win10 HC White theme: ### Steps to reproduce 1. Turn on High Contrast theme in Windows settings 2. Create a WinForms .NET core project 3. Add a DataGridView control 4. Expand smart tag and click "Add column..." to add a column 5. Ctrl+Shift+A add a Application Manifest File and uncomment windows 10 6. Build and run 7. Observe the icon of "AddNew" **More info:** 1. This issue cannot repro on win11 HC Desert theme. 2. This issue is repro on win10 machine but cannot repro on win10 HC White theme. 3. This issue can repro on framework project.

Issues.Title: MonthCalendar accessible objects are leaking in memory
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

8.0.100-alpha.1.22430.2

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

No

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

No

### Issue description

MonthCalendar accessible objects are left in memory after the MonthCalendar control instance was inspected with accessibility tool: just Narrator and the form with MonthCalendar is closed, garbage is collected, but Narrator is still opened.

Report from WinDbg:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/26474449/187897002-dc0db060-5181-4a03-803c-3dbe7fc24272.png)


### Steps to reproduce

1. Create a parent form with two buttons: one will be opening a child form with the MonthCalendar control and the other will collect the garbage.
2. Press the second button to open the child form with MonthCalendar.
3. Start the Accessibility Insights tools.
4. Run automated checks for the MonthCalendar control using Narrator.
5. Close the child form.
6. Clear memory with the first button of the parent form.
7. DON'T close Narrator.
8. Look for MonthCalendar accessible objects left in memory (using WinDbg, or dotMemory, or another suitable tool).

Tested sample application: 
[WinFormsApp5_MonthCalendar.zip](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/files/9469213/WinFormsApp5_MonthCalendar.zip)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "MonthCalendar accessible objects are leaking in memory" (#7715)
